reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nSirius Online has a LONG way to go, but the developer is extremely active and always involved with the community. That's right. Developer. One guy is programming this game, which is pretty amazing considering the steady rate of updates hat the game now sees. There is not a whole lot to do right now, but if things continue at their current pace, Sirius Online will become memorable for all the right reasons.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

!!! Important !!!
Currently it is not yet a game to play (you can already do some things), it is ALPHA and you should be aware of this. Don't buy it, if you want to play immediately! Buy it if you want to support its development and if you want to play it in future!

I say that, because reading the negativ reviews, it seems, that people do not understand, what early access stands for.

After reading all reviews and every information about the game I decided to buy this game to support its development.

The vision of this game, as I understand when reading about it, is exactly what I am looking for: a space sim with mostly player generated content. A really multiplayer experience in space. If it will be massively multiplayer can not yet be said as this is difficult and expensive to realise. But for the beginning, multiplayer would be enough, at least for me.

It seems, that Sirius Online aims for the missing parts of Elite:Dangerous, namely depth. The PvE (Player versus Environment) of Elite:Dangerous is not enough content on a longer time scale. EVE Online is to much spreadsheet and not enough active action. Sirius Online can be the middle course in between and thats what I am hoping for.

The current client is already very good to handle. Its easy to fly around and controls seems to be on a good balance. Flying around is already fun. Mining is also possible, according to other reviews, but I didn't try. So, the game now has a good base to build the system on top of it and fill everything with the game mechanics. Graphics and sounds are fine too but not yet on a current state of the art but promissing.

When you start the game, be prepared that the developer is somewhere around and talks to you. Giving input or asking questions directly to the developer is very nice and not very often seen. But if this game gains momentum it will be more difficult for him, to be accessible like that. So don't expect this in future.

Conclusion:
Promissing game idea and a sound base already available, but yet a lot of things to do. Buy it to help the developer to make it real.

To the developer: Great game, exceptional endurance. Stay on this path and we will be with you. Maybe you should consider to bring some more people into your development.

Rex

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Ok....so, here is the skinny.

I got this title as a gift. Then I played it and looked up the price. It is one dollar at the time of this review.

ONE DOLLAR. So, ya, it's totally worth it.

The wait for an actual Freelancer style game will be some time. This game has more problems than Carter had pills. I've spent more on Android games that had less, still.

My personal experience may be different than yours but it was this experience that will keep me waiting for updates and eventually a release.

So, my buddy and I got into this game after he gifted it to me and it rapidly became apparant that there was not much to it. You spawn in, there is no map. Most of the keys do nothing. Spacebar to toggle mouse flight. AI that fly's the same way and can be exploited. Mining is super esay. Fly up super close and shoot it till you are full of cargo. No explanations on ships or much of anything in the store. Basically the most basics of all things. Kinda like playing an old school Ninetendo game that was a lot of trial and error.

This is what did it for me. The Developer logs in. Ya, that guy. The one person making this game. He answered all questions we had and told of some of his future plans. He even spawned in a huge Capital craft that made everything else look like a tiny ink blot. His love for this game is apparant and you can honestly feel his passion.

I will stay in the loop and wait until this has some more playability and I would usually tell everyone to run from a title like this but the developer did it for me. My buddy even had framerate issues and the Dev tried to fix it right then and there. The Cap ship was a sight to see and his dreams of future development are astounding.

Get it. Play it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I am really enjoying this game, although I haven't met the developer Dex ingame. I met a fellow player who helped me a lot, he tought me the best places to go to make serious money and the best way to get through the early access at the moment.

The things I was told was:
Fly from the Andromeda Station to Sirius IV (Go past Sirius II, then keep a lookour for Sirius IV and use the raday (shift+v))
As soon as Sirius IV is visible look for GNC15 and head towards it.
Once you've reached it sell all ores in the Market tab (F5).
Next look for an asteroid belt that contains the letters 1982 and head towards it.
Stay on the outer edges on the asteroid belt and mine the smaller asteroids by noclipping inside the astoroid (just fly inside it)
Once your cargo's full return to GNC15 and sell everything, you'll even collect Elitium which is worth the most.
Once everything is sold repeat the steps until you can afford a mining ship (labelled 'M' in the ship section of the market)
You'll be able to store a lot more ore with a mining ship, I recommend the 'Kliper'.There is also a chance you'll log back into the game with the starting ship and be back at the Andromeda Station, so it's best to save up 500k+ maybe even 1mil so you can easily purchase ships if you die and lose it.

Good luck fellow players, and I can't wait to play this after it's full release!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Honestly? It may not really be worth a purchase at the moment but this is definitely a game worth following at least to see how it turns out. If you played Freelancer and are a fan of the game then you'll most definitely want to check this game out. Plays and feels like it.

While there are quite a lot of bugs and the game is currently bare bones, there is a lot you can forgive it for considering there is only one dev I believe working on it. Considering what you usually expect from Early Access games it plays surprisingly well minus the few bugs in controls and netcode so far seems good. Currently there is only PvP and Mining at the moment, oh and flying into the darkness of space and getting lost. Not much to do, but still at least playable.

So yeah, keep an eye on this one. While it really doesn't have much at the moment to offer, it will be interesting to see what the updates will bring.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Just to make a few things clear that most people have already make clear, but nonetheless: This game is in a VERY EARLY ALPHA. It is playable, and I enjoy doing the little quests and raiding some pirate ships (got balls m8?). It is difficult to write a concrete review complete with pros and cons as by the time somebody reads this, the features will have already been updated as the developer is CRAZY at work on this thing. That being said, I won't write many cons, as most the cons are either bug related and should go in the forums, or are planned to be fixed in the future.

So, some things I really liked are that the controls are relatively simple to pick up. They are really similar to the controls in StarMade, except MUCH easier and smoother. The weapon section in the market isn't implemented yet, but you still have 3 weapons to start with, excluding a mining laser. There is a short range rapid fire laser, a mid-range slower firing laser, and a long range and powerful sniping laser (I find it effective at taking out pirate ships from a distance).

Some things I didn't like (these do not include the bugs or things that I am aware of that are being worked on) is how every life you lose just seems disposable. Unless you bought a ship, dying just doesn't have that big of a consequence that I can feel. And speaking of the ships, whenever you die, the ship you are piloting (excluding the default ship) is removed permanently from your possession until you buy another one. This almost makes the entire idea of buying ships rather redundant in my opinion. If i grind for something, I'd like to keep it. I don't know, maybe there are some fans of systems like that found in Realm of the Mad God, where a death resets your character, but I am not one of them.

Other than that, I had, and plan to have, fun with this game in the future. Community is a little small but really die hard and passionate for the game, and the developer 10x that. It may not look like much now, but it's $2.99 right now. That's cheaper than a large drink at the McDonald's in our town. Why not give it a shot?

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First and foremost, I AM RUNNING UBUNTU 14.04.
Secondly, YOU WILL BE CONFUSED WHEN YOU GET IN GAME
Lastly, I know I don't have very much playtime, but i've done as much as I could bear before I looked for all the share buttons.

Although still in very early access, I would give this an easy 7/10 so far, 3 deducted for lack of players and the obvious repetitious grind for that next ship. For a game made by only 1 person, this is just outstanding. Running soooooo much better than any company built game, absolutely no hiccups, tearing visuals, or glitches that i've found.

I'm not adding in everything, because SPOILERS. DO NOT SPOILER THIS GAME. IT WILL RUIN IT. (How about just enough to get you slightly ready >:3 )
Pros:
OPEN ♥♥♥♥ING SPACE DUDE. DO YOU EVEN TRAVEL? SPPPPAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACE
Safe Area in the first spot to 'mine'. You take 0 damage (however, the short flight there you can get hit.)
No steering while HSD is active. This makes absolute sense <3 cancel at any time
Market. It may not look like much yet, but there's so much potential.
THE EXPLOSIONS. Same explosion, same burst of joy :D
Death. Whelp, that ship was fun while it lasted. 1 ship is always free c:
Jump right in with absolutely NO IDEA WHAT ANYTHING DOES! I love this one. The game was built for you to EXPLORE EVERYTHING, so that means you're relying on your own intellect and common sense. This will surely keep anyone entertained as long as they have the patience.
*The dev does reply when you send him messages. It's an awesome feeling when a dev replies.*
*HSD activation leaves a signal behind for a brief moment*

Cons:
Hud layout. (Might be because of linux)
Constantly wondering what to do next.
If there's a ship selection, I haven't found it, only the buy button. Therefor: Buy ship, you're flying that ship.
Lack of options. No volume adjust.
No bulk-buy option for the game. *Seeing the price, should be at least a 4 pack :3 )*
*You can get lost* (PROTIP: Drop a beacon before you head out. The button above the settings on the left hand screen tells you how)*
*Lack of players*

EDITS ARE IN **
Removed from cons + how they are fixed:
Notification bar overlaps every button in the bottom right corner of the market. I haz a sad. (HIT THE BACKSPACE BUTTON. IT TRULY HELPS)
_______________________
I will be constantly adding/removing/changing upon each update, as I will be devoting time into this.
This is more than worth the discounted price I got it at. Once you get the jist of what the game is literally telling you what to do, GET OUT THERE AND BLAZE YOUR OWN RIPPLES THROUGH SPAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACE

reviewText:
Early Access Review

While Ive chosen not recommended, this review is meant to be neutral as while I enjoy playing, it just has some problems to address before Id fully recommend it
TL;DR skip to the line

Firstly the game is develeped by two brothers Rene 'Dex' Dirks and Michael 'Xaymar' Dirks currently, and has been in development for 15 years according to the kickstarter

The controls are decent only took a few moments to adjust, Ive played a bit and its pretty fun, but lacking diversity in things to do. As far as I managed to figure out you shoot asteroids ore spawns you run into it go to the nearest station sell it do nothing with your money, and maybe kill things(crashed trying to kill some unnamed thing with 10k health) I would not recommend buying in its current state unless its on sale

Mostly what this game needs is more players both to support the dev and to build the community
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Pros+
+ Looks decent graphically and there are plans to improve
+ Also plans for a new engine
+ Controls are actually pretty good
+ Devs seem active, friendly and answer questions swiftly
+ Theres a suicide button
+ If all promises are met this game will be great
+ Very open world worth exploring
+ Dynamic economy(prices fluctuate based on how much ore is sold to particular stations)
+12 or so ships, with possible plans for more

Negatives-
- Not much to do besides mine, sell ore, and shoot things
- Money doesnt seem to have any use yet
- The UI is currently missing ingame options and a few other more minor things
- Few people online (but growing and those Ive seen are pretty friendly)
- Switching to a new engine may slow the addition of more content/features

Will update this as updates to the game happen

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First, remember that this is Early Access.  It's not complete, it crashes, it has exploits, it has bugs, it has issues.  If you don't want to help make it better or want to spend you hard earned money on a finished product, don't buy this game.

Also know that this game has everything going against it.  A failed kickstarter, a single developer, and a game engine most people haven't heard of.  This is reason enough to simply avoid buying it.  I took a chance on it after hearing how involved the developer was - and every review that points this out is absolutely correct.  Dex is on ALL.  THE.  TIME.

If you want to see the developer ACTIVELY engaging players every day, getting feedback, revealing the short and long term plans, the ideas put into the game, then this is what you want.  Dex is super involved and the community is supportive of new players.  He has a Herculean work ethic, and that is why I'm glad to have bought the game - to support a developer who is passionate and consistent.

As for the game itself, there isn't a lot to do.  Blow up pirates, their hideouts, mine, PVP, complete missions, and explore around.  Only 2 tiers of spaceships are available at this time.  Combat feels soft, mining requires flying over chunks of asteroid to pick them up, and there's no customization to anything.  The list is long and changing all the time.

It's getting better, it's growing fast, and it's going to be a great product.  Get in now and help!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have been playing Sirius Online for quite some time now and have to say that its got to be one of my favorite early access games on steam.  I have read alot of the reviews and I think many forget this game is still in PRE-ALPHA. For a game this new I have to say the Dev is doing an amazing job!  Very rarely do I write anything about the the Devs but many have commented to me ingame that his love for this game, willingness to listen to new ideas and interaction with its fans is event as soon as you logon. I have watched him continue to answer everyone's questions time after time and even guide people through the ever expanding galaxy which is getting bigger every day. Although I dont know him personaly, I have never seen a game where the Dev takes a personal interest like this and its very commendable.
As for the game itself, The graphics are very well done and vibrant especially the planets. The combat in this game is top-notch especially for pre-alpha! Strafing and free movement (Ship follows mouse) makes this game so much fun for PVP or just guiding the ship around planets or astroids. The new ships of different kinds and strengths (Mining, combat and transport) continue to get the community excited for whats coming next.  Warp Speed or Hyper Jump as many call it makes the game very realistic and moving from one area to the next can be done with ease. Grouping with friends for fun dogfight PVP, doing mining or just exploring by yourself for new stations and hidden astroid belts for mining is addicting. Honestly I cant wait for the new updates and for the full version. If you havent tried out the game download it now!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'm not sure how to feel about this game I have super mixed feelings about it... sure it's nice, the plane/space jet thingy designs and flying is some of the best I've seen BUT it's a huge bore-fest right now!

So the good stuff the game only has resolution options, full screen and windowed... I guess you could say this is good? The game has one thing going for it and I mean this is what should be focused on THE FLYING AND STYLE OF THE GAME I LOVE IT, please don't get rid of the super cool plane/space jet thingy designs!

Now the bad I mean again like I said before that game only has resolution options, full screen and windowed... eh I don't know. The game right now is BORING mine, mine, mine... on top of that the tutorial seems broken because I can't finish it AND the steam achievements don't seem to work either.  THE GAME HAS NO OTHER OPTIONS aside from selecting English and disabling/enabling the tutorial... there is no audio sliders nothing nope! I feel like as the years go by the more I find myself using the windows volume mixer just because it seems like no one can get audio options right! It's either too loud, too quiet or no options at all.

Now I know I seem a little harsh but I do know that it's only $0.99 USD and I picked it up for $0.50 USD so I can easily give this a pass, it's only one guy working on it by the looks of things so to get this far alone it seems great. I'll be honest I don't think I'll come back to this game unless I see more improvements I REALLY DO hope you focus on the flying physics, style and combat because that's the fun part... not mining please, please for the love of life not mining!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Okay, so I have had this game for sometime now, and I felt my review needs updating in light of the latest news regarding this game.

This game has great potential, and the developers are constantly working on making it a better game. Their latest announcement that the game will be re-established into Unreal Engine 4 from its current engine proves this.

What does this mean for the game? Well, improved graphics, performance and overall gameplay.

I will stick to my previous judgement that this game has amazing potential and that it is definitely something to look forward to. You might not enjoy it all that much now, but the future looks bright for this gem.

Get it now and help support this developer in their endevours to make this an amazing game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I cannot in good faith recommend this game.  I have played the game for all of 15 minutes and already shut the game down and asked for a Refund.  First off, there is no actual login system and if you mess up on your Username (Mind you, no password) you cannot log in or someone else can easily log into your account.  Once in, I had the unfortunate experience of dealing with the Tutorial System in which is very basic, the voice is EXTREMELY annoying and you can only go so far before you cannot complete the rest of the tutorial.

It is very easy to get blown up if you are in the wrong section of the game and there are literally NO warning signs or even direction in the game.  Last night when I logged in, their Dev _Dex actually started to fire at me and proceeded to try and blow me up multiple times.  I was able to take him out first but that is NOT how you want to introduce your game to someone.... Sure, I see a new person... Lets blow him up and not even talk to anyone while doing it or even ask before engaging.  THEN HE WAS EXTREMELY UPSET AFTER I BLEW UP HIS SHIP!!!!  Really!?!?!?

Pros:
* Easy to setup account and play
* Easily get to areas of the galaxy
* No one other than NPCs to shoot at you.

Cons:
* Annoying Tutorial Lady's Voice.
* Takes a while to accumulate any value of money (Yes, I know... Played for 15 minutes).
* Wander outside starting station within 15 lightyears and a volley of weapons fire attacks you, destrying you in 2 seconds.
* Devs do NOT talk to you at all in game, show up and try to blow you up with their L337 ship.
* UI is very basic and looks like a child built it (Is actually hard to use by the way).
* Game Controls are horrible.
* Direction System is very lacking in the fact that you literally have no idea where your at unless you use those trade lanes.
* No escape function on keyboard or a Log Out/Exit Button in game.  Need to EndTask or click X on game window.

All-In-All, this game has SOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO much to refine before actually being released that it isnt funny.  The tutorial system and menu ui need to be tweaked badely and there just needs to be a complete overhaul unfortunately before it will be a good game to play.  This game will not have my support as long as it is in its current and almost unbarible state of gameplay.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

+++DISCLAIMER+++
I was given a steam code by the developer in order for me to help promote awareness of the game, however in saying that any and all thoughts on Sirius Online are my own and I have tried to be as fair as possible

Sirius Online is a space-themed MMO by Vektor Studios run by Rene and Michael Dirks.

The game literally came onto Steam Early Access on 1st June 2015 and I am writing this after playing just over an hour, so call this a preview or first impressions if you wish!

I'll tell you now I'm a big sci-fi and space game nut, so excuse me if I sound a tad biased with this short writeup.

Sirius Online currently uses the Blitz3D game engine which is a free open source piece of software and honestly for what it is I feel that the guys at Vektor Studios have done a great job, pushing the engine to it's very limits and beyond its' capabilites.

In the current Alpha state you start with a small combat fighter and have to go round mining ores from asteroids to obtain more credits to buy a new ship, be it fighter, mining or transport class" where there are several variations of ships in each of these.

I feel the gameplay in its' current form is impressive and will develop over time
recommended: hud options and even bigger ships are planned but so far Sirius has been very smooth and I have yet to drop below 50fps on my machine.\n\nAt present the game does feel a little bit grindy but it's a) In Alpha state and b) Early access
hoursPlayed: which means that it will have bugs
voteText: will have changes made and will be taking input from fellow gamers in order to improve upon it.\n\nI have chatted to the developer and they are definately passionate about what they are doing
helpfulPercent: Sirius Online is a labour of love and they want to do right by it
votesHelpful: I really hope they can pull it off because I can see a massive amount of potential in this game and I'm looking forward to covering it more as updates roll in.\n\nI suppose the question you want to ask me would be "Is Sirius Online worth its' £6.99 pricetag?"
votesTotal: my simple answer would be yes
votesFunny: however I'm not about one word answers
commentsCount: I not only think that you should buy into this game
column16: but also help mould it because games like this need fellow gamers like you to come along
column17: find errors/suggest content and really have the chance to build a game that you want to play
column18: not what the developer wants to play.  Together as a community we are stronger so why nto become part of one?\n\nI suggest...no I challenge you to buy this game and meet me in space
column19: shoot me down in cold blood and then tell me you didn't enjoy it."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Got it for free, and I have to say I feel like I've been ripped off. I'm open to early access games, but this is little more than some poorly modeled assets thrown together. I got some sort of strange black circle around a star, clipped through asteroids, and played through a poor voice-only tutorial. No subtitles or on-screen text, and no guidance on what anything is. Tutorial covers different classes of weapons, but doesn't indicate which are which. Then came some attempts at mining. At first, I found in strange that all the rocks that spawned off the asteroid looked the same, so I turned to get a different angle on them. Turns out, you can't even turn your ship in the same space as the rotational point is not the center of the ship. The rocks still looked the same-that's when it hit me, they're 2D sprites! Somehow, in the 12 years since Freelancer, Rene Marcel Dirks has found a way to reverse the trend of improving graphics. You'd be much better served playing Freelancer, you could probably find a more populated server. I tried to find a way to exit the game, but there's not even a menu!

Coupled with now being worked on by one person, development will be moving along slowly.

tl;dr: Avoid, try Elite: Dangerous, or X3:AP if you want a Freelancer experience. You'll even find the same number of players in X3!
e:fixed factual error e2: fixed additional factual error. Thanks Sakif and Xaymar.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Whatever it was that resembled Freelancer is now dead. Forum, server, and game is now lifeless. This game is server dependent  to even log in and it is nonoperational. I've only refunded 2 games on steam before. Sadly (despite the Freelanceresque description) there is nothing here to play.

Edit: I wouldn't be this harsh if I didn't feel like I stepped into an absolute mess when I bought it. Looking at the reviews, it definitely seems like something was here at one point. But in the end, (after a ton of research) you will find lots of dev drama, with no thought of a LAN feature.  Shooting for the mmo was a crumbling mistake.  This game could be saved with a dedicated function.  Give up the mmo dev fame complexity, and build it the way it was meant to be.

Income is way better.
